title: Data Analysis: Residual Plots
question_text:
Which statements is/are true concerning residual plots?

I. A residual plot is constructed by plotting the explanatory variable values on the $x$-axis against the residuals on the $y$-axis. II. A residual plot should have a positive slope if the slope of the least squares regression line is above zero. III. A residual plot shows how the errors in a linear regression model are arranged.
solution:
Statements I and III are correct. These statements describe how to construct a residual plot and what residual plots hope to display.

Statement II is incorrect; residual plots should have a slope of zero or near zero.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'E'.
